alert.note: Alert for Steele (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 9:09AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Steele County through 1000 AM CDT... At 909 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles southwest of Owatonna, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Medford around 925 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Owatonna. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 33 and 47. U.S. Highway 14 between mile markers 166 and 182. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
